arts.ttl: Birmingham City player ratings after Stansfield scores again to dismiss Burton
arts.sum: The right-back played a lovely pass through to Willumsson in the build-up to Blues’ second goal. The goalkeeper played his part in Blues’ second goal with a crisp pass out to Laird to start the attack.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies reveals pre-game surprise that Birmingham City were beyond prepared for
arts.sum: Burton have often played a back four this season, but they switched to a back five for the trip to St Andrew’s. “I gave the players a load of messages about them playing a back four before the game and then I had to change when I got the team sheet because I saw they were playing a back five,” said Davies.

arts.ttl: Tom Wagner's bet is paying off as Chris Davies lands Birmingham City problem
arts.sum: Blues have now won seven games on the spin in all competitions and Chris Davies has rewarded his players by giving them Christmas Day off. Stansfield has 11 goals in 14 League One games – 13 across all competitions – and the best strike-rate of any player at the level.

arts.ttl: Jay Stansfield on target again as leaders Birmingham beat Burton
arts.sum: The striker now has 14 goals for the season.

arts.ttl: Chris Davies gives Birmingham City players a Christmas gift after seven straight wins
arts.sum: When Blues were at their lowest ebb this season following the defeat at Shrewsbury Town on November 23, Davies challenged his players to win every game before Christmas – and their 1-0 victory at Crawley Town ensured they returned to top of the League One table. Davies explained: “After the Shrewsbury game, it was obviously a bit of a low moment for us, and I said to the players if we win every single game between now and Christmas Day then they can have Christmas Day at home with their families.

arts.ttl: Birmingham City’s dream January as Neumann replaces Sanderson and wildcard arrives - Alex Dicken
arts.sum: Blues signed 17 new players for Davies and kept the likes of Krystian Bielik, Ethan Laird, Lee Buchanan, Paik Seung-ho and Keshi Anderson to build a squad most Championship clubs would be envious of, let alone their League One rivals. The 27-year-old has been one of the stand-out centre-backs in Bundesliga II in the past three seasons and would be a coup signing for Blues, particularly while the club is still in League One. Neumann is out-of-contract at Hannover in the summer and Blues could move in January before a scramble for a free transfer ensues.

arts.ttl: I was sacked by Birmingham City via text message after furious response to relegation
arts.sum: Montgomery had agreed a deal to sign Russian striker Roman Pavlyuchenko in the January before he scored a brace for Spurs to relegate Blues. Former Birmingham City talent-spotter Paul Montgomery has revealed the fiery text message exchange which saw him sacked after the club was relegated from the Premier League in 2011.

arts.ttl: Birmingham City transfer state of play as Chris Davies' January objectives become clear
arts.sum: A lack of game time will inevitably lead to some players requesting moves elsewhere, which Davies has already acknowledged, so Blues have drawn up lists to replace those whose futures are in doubt. “Myself, Craig Gardner and the recruitment team always meet to discuss where the squad is at and we’re looking forward to future transfer windows to have a good picture and make sure we’re planned,” Davies said.

arts.ttl: Preview: Birmingham City vs. Burton Albion - prediction, team news, lineups
arts.sum: Sports Mole previews Thursday's League One clash between Birmingham City and Burton Albion, including predictions, team news and possible lineups.
